body: @TomAugspurger are you OK with this? In that case, will do the same for 0.24.2 as well.

Yeah, good for now.

Back when we backported manually, we passed the `-x` flag to include "cherry picked from"...
Does anyone know if this is what let GitHub retain the author information?
See https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/commit/7bfed01cb260c6d4a982f8de217d47b2f4396610

@Carreau is possible to configure meeseeksdev to include `-x` in the args at https://github.com/MeeseeksBox/MeeseeksDev/blob/77bac5daf0f9b2505bcdbe59dd0f1c75ceb36e64/meeseeksdev/meeseeksbox/commands.py#L434 (maybe there are downsides to that)?

It's not the `-x` from backporting manually that did the trick before, I think. It is just because we were directly cherry-picking, which preserves the commit author (although it change the commit committer). 

Here, the problem comes from going through a PR on github. Eg the commit in https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/25663 still has correctly chris-b1 as the commit author (since the commit itself is just a cherry-pick). But when merging that PR, the PR author becomes the commit author of the squashed merged commit (and this is GitHub doing that, I think).

I opened https://github.com/MeeseeksBox/MeeseeksDev/issues/35 before as a possible solution.

Another solution might be that we don't squash backport PRs, but just merge them with a merge commit or with rebase and merge. But, then we always need to remember doing that for backport PRs, which is also error prone.

Ah thanks for the explanation.

I think manually adding the authors is best for now.

On Mon, Mar 11, 2019 at 10:37 AM Joris Van den Bossche <
notifications@github.com> wrote:

>

>
> Another solution might be that we don't squash backport PRs, but just
> merge them with a merge commit or with rebase and merge. But, then we
> always need to remember doing that for backport PRs, which is also error
> prone.
>

> .
>
Personally, I think that GitHub should automatically do the "Co-authored-by" thing when squashing a PR that has multiple commit authors .. but that's a change outside our reach.

give them to you. Let me know. I will try to see if we can do something
about authorship.
